intro: Tithymalus eochlorus, commonly known as the yellow tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a distinctive scent when crushed. Tithymalus eochlorus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
